identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Valsartan and Amlodipine (± HCTZ) in Adults With Moderate, Inadequately Controlled Hypertension
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Open-label, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Tolerability of a 4 Week Therapy With the Fixed Dose Combination of Amlodipine 10 mg Plus Valsartan 160 mg in Hypertensive Patients Not Adequately Responding to a 4 Week Therapy With the Free Combination of an Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (Olmesartan 20 mg) Plus Amlodipine 10 mg

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of valsartan and amlodipine in fixed dose combination in adults with moderate, inadequately controlled hypertension. There was an optional study extension for eligible patients who wanted to participate that contains the triple therapy (ie, hydrochlorothiazide+ amlodipine/valsartan).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: Title of study extension: An open-label, multicenter extension to evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of a 4 week therapy with hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg plus amlodipine 10 mg/valsartan 160 mg in hypertensive patients not adequately responding to a 4 week therapy each with the combinations of olmesartan 20 mg plus amlodipine 10 mg followed by amlodipine 10 mg/valsartan 160 mg

armGroups.label: Amlodipine(AML)+olmesartan, AML+valsartan, AML+valsartan+HCTZ
armGroups.description: During the Treatment Phase 1, participants received 1 week of treatment with olmesartan 10 mg and amlodipine 5 mg once daily in free combination, followed by three weeks of treatment with olmesartan 20 mg plus amlodipine 10 mg once daily in free combination. During the treatment Phase 2 of the study participants received amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg for 4 weeks. During the Extension Phase, participants received 4 weeks treatment with amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg plus hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ) 12.5 mg.

interventions.name: Amlodipine
interventions.description: Amlodipine supplied as 5 mg tablets, taken orally once a day during Treatment Phase 1 only.

interventions.name: Olmesartan medoxomil
interventions.description: Olmesartan medoxomil supplied as 10 mg tablets taken once a day during Treatment Phase 1 only.

interventions.name: Amlodipine+valsartan
interventions.description: Fixed-dose combination of amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg tablet taken orally once a day during Treatment Phase 2 and Extension Phase.

interventions.name: Hydrochlorothiazide
interventions.description: Hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ) 12.5 mg tablets taken once a day during the Extension Phase.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Mean Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (msDBP) During the Core Phase of the Study
primaryOutcomes.description: The arm in which the highest sitting diastolic pressures were found at study entry was the arm used for all subsequent readings. A calibrated sphygmomanometer and appropriate size cuff were used to measure arterial sitting blood pressure (BP) at trough with the arm supported at the level of the heart. At each study visit, after having the patient in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes, systolic/diastolic blood pressure were measured 3 times at 1-2 minute intervals. A mean was calculated from the 3 measurements. A negative change indicates improvement.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 2 (Week 4) to end of Phase 2 (Week 8)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Mean Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (msDBP) During the Extension Phase of the Study
primaryOutcomes.description: The arm in which the highest sitting diastolic pressures were found at study entry was the arm used for all subsequent readings. A calibrated sphygmomanometer and appropriate size cuff were used to measure arterial sitting blood pressure (BP) at trough with the arm supported at the level of the heart. At each study visit, after having the patient in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes, systolic/diastolic blood pressure were measured 3 times at 1-2 minute intervals. A mean was calculated from the 3 measurements. A negative change indicates improvement.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 3 (Week 8) to end of Phase 3 (Week 12)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Mean Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure (msSBP) During the Core Phase of the Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: The arm in which the highest sitting diastolic pressures were found at study entry was the arm used for all subsequent readings. A calibrated sphygmomanometer and appropriate size cuff were used to measure arterial sitting blood pressure (BP) at trough with the arm supported at the level of the heart. At each study visit, after having the patient in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes, systolic/diastolic blood pressure were measured 3 times at 1-2 minute intervals. A mean was calculated from the 3 measurements. A negative change indicates improvement.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 2 (Week 4) to end of Phase 2 (Week 8)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Sitting Pulse Pressure During the Core Phase of the Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pulse pressure is systolic pressure (SP) minus diastolic pressure (DP). The arm in which the highest sitting DPs were found at study entry was the arm used for all subsequent readings. A calibrated sphygmomanometer and appropriate size cuff were used to measure arterial sitting blood pressure (BP) at trough with the arm supported at the level of the heart. At each study visit, after having the patient in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes, SP and DP were measured 3 times at 1-2 minute intervals. A mean was calculated from the 3 measurements. A negative change indicates improvement.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 2 (Week 4) to end of Phase 2 (Week 8)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Sitting Pulse Rate During the Core Phase of the Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pulse rate was measured once for 30 seconds just prior to blood pressure measurements in the sitting position.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 2 (Week 4) to end of Phase 2 (Week 8)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Achieved Normalized Blood Pressure During the Core Phase of the Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: Normalized Blood Pressure was defined as a msSBP \< 140 mmHg and/or a msDBP \< 90 mmHg.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 2 (Week 4) to end of Phase 2 (Week 8)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Achieved a Protocol-defined Blood Pressure Response During the Core Phase of the Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: Blood pressure response was defined as msSBP \< 140 mmHg or a 20 mmHg decrease in msSBP at the end of Phase 2 (Week 8) compared to Baseline in Phase 2 (week 4) or a msDBP \< 90 mmHg or a 10 mmHg decrease in msDBP at the end of Phase 2 compared to Baseline in Phase 2.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline of Phase 2 (Week 4) to end of Phase 2 (Week 8)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Mean Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure (msSBP) During the Extension Phase of the Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: The arm in which the highest sitting diastolic pressures were found at study entry was the arm used for all subsequent readings. A calibrated sphygmomanometer and appropriate size cuff were used to measure arterial sitting blood pressure (BP) at trough with the arm supported at the level of the heart. At each study visit, after having the patient in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes, systolic/diastolic blood pressure were measured 3 times at 1-2 minute intervals. A mean was calculated from the 3 measurements. A negative change indicates improvement.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 3 (Week 8) to end of Phase 3 (Week 12)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Sitting Pulse Pressure During the Extension Phase of the Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pulse pressure is systolic pressure (SP) minus diastolic pressure (DP). The arm in which the highest sitting DPs were found at study entry was the arm used for all subsequent readings. A calibrated sphygmomanometer and appropriate size cuff were used to measure arterial sitting blood pressure (BP) at trough with the arm supported at the level of the heart. At each study visit, after having the patient in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes, SP and DP were measured 3 times at 1-2 minute intervals. A mean was calculated from the 3 measurements. A negative change indicates improvement.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 3 (Week 8) to end of Phase 3 (Week 12)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Sitting Pulse Rate During the Extension Phase of the Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: Pulse rate was measured once for 30 seconds just prior to blood pressure measurements in the sitting position.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 3 (Week 8) to end of Phase 3 (week 12)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Achieved Normalized Blood Pressure During the Extension Phase of the Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: Normalized Blood Pressure was defined as a msSBP \< 140 mmHg and/or a msDBP \< 90 mmHg.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 3 (Week 8) to end of Phase 3 (Week 12)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Achieved a Protocol-defined Blood Pressure Response During the Extension Phase of the Study
secondaryOutcomes.description: Blood pressure response was defined as msSBP \< 140 mmHg or a 20 mmHg decrease in msSBP at the end of Phase 3 compared to Baseline in Phase 3 or a msDBP \< 90 mmHg or a 10 mmHg decrease in msDBP at the end of Phase 3 compared to Baseline in Phase 3.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline of Phase 3 (Week 8) to end of Phase 3 (Week 12)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria for Core study:

* Male or female patients (\>=18 years)
* Females must be either post-menopausal for one year, surgically sterile or using effective contraceptive methods
* Patients with essential hypertension (diastolic blood pressure \>=100 mmHg and \<110 mmHg)

Inclusion Criteria for Extension:

- Patients had to have a msSBP \>= 140 mmHg and/or msDBP \>= 90 mmHg at week 8 ie, end of core study.

Exclusion Criteria for Core study:

* Severe hypertension (diastolic blood pressure \>=110 mmHg or systolic blood pressure \>= 180 mmHg)
* Pregnant or nursing women
* Treated hypertensive patients with controlled hypertension under current therapy
* A history of cardiovascular disease, including angina pectoris, myocardial infarction, coronary artery bypass graft, percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty, transient ischemic attack, stroke, and heart failure NYHA II - IV

Exclusion Criteria for Extension:

* prematurely discontinued the core study
* failed to comply with the core study protocol

Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria applied to the study.

groups.title: Amlodipine(AML)+Olmesartan, AML+Valsartan, AML+Valsartan+HCTZ
groups.description: During the Treatment Phase 1, participants received 1 week of treatment with olmesartan 10 mg and amlodipine 5 mg once daily in free combination, followed by three weeks of treatment with olmesartan 20 mg plus amlodipine 10 mg once daily in free combination. During the Treatment Phase 2 participants received amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg for 4 weeks. During the Extension Phase, participants received 4 weeks treatment with amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg plus hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ) 12.5 mg.

achievements.comment: Only patients with mean sitting diastolic BP ≥ 90 mmHg at the end of Phase 1 entered this phase.
Only patients with systolic BP ≥ 140 mmHg or diastolic BP ≥ 90 mmHg at the end of Phase 2.

groups.title: Amlodipine(AML)+Olmesartan, AML+Valsartan, AML+Valsartan+HCTZ
groups.description: During the Treatment Phase 1, participants received 1 week of treatment with olmesartan 10 mg and amlodipine 5 mg once daily in free combination, followed by three weeks of treatment with olmesartan 20 mg plus amlodipine 10 mg once daily in free combination. During the Treatment Phase 2 participants received amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg for 4 weeks. During the Extension Phase, participants received 4 weeks treatment with amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg plus hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ) 12.5 mg.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Mean Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (msDBP) During the Core Phase of the Study
outcomeMeasures.description: The arm in which the highest sitting diastolic pressures were found at study entry was the arm used for all subsequent readings. A calibrated sphygmomanometer and appropriate size cuff were used to measure arterial sitting blood pressure (BP) at trough with the arm supported at the level of the heart. At each study visit, after having the patient in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes, systolic/diastolic blood pressure were measured 3 times at 1-2 minute intervals. A mean was calculated from the 3 measurements. A negative change indicates improvement.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Intent-to-treat population (ITT): All patients who took at least one dose of amlodipine plus valsartan who had at least one primary efficacy parameter evaluation. Patients who dropped out were included in the ITT population if there was any BP measurement available; their last available blood pressure measurement was used for the analysis.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 2 (Week 4) to end of Phase 2 (Week 8)

groups.title: Amlodipine+Valsartan - Phase 2
groups.description: Patients with uncontrolled mean sitting diastolic BP (msDBP ≥ 90 mmHg) at the end of Phase 1 were treated for 4 weeks with amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg taken orally in the morning.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Mean Sitting Systolic Blood Pressure (msSBP) During the Core Phase of the Study

groups.title: Amlodipine+Valsartan - Phase 2
groups.description: Patients with uncontrolled mean sitting diastolic BP (msDBP ≥ 90 mmHg) at the end of Phase 1 were treated for 4 weeks with amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg taken orally in the morning.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Mean Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (msDBP) During the Extension Phase of the Study
outcomeMeasures.description: The arm in which the highest sitting diastolic pressures were found at study entry was the arm used for all subsequent readings. A calibrated sphygmomanometer and appropriate size cuff were used to measure arterial sitting blood pressure (BP) at trough with the arm supported at the level of the heart. At each study visit, after having the patient in a sitting position for at least 5 minutes, systolic/diastolic blood pressure were measured 3 times at 1-2 minute intervals. A mean was calculated from the 3 measurements. A negative change indicates improvement.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Safety population: All patients who took at least one dose of amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg plus HCTZ 12.5 mg.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 3 (Week 8) to end of Phase 3 (Week 12)

groups.title: Amlodipine+Valsartan+HCTZ - Phase 3
groups.description: Patients with uncontrolled mean sitting systolic or diastolic blood pressure (msDBP ≥ 90 mmHg and/or msSBP ≥ 140 mmHg) at the end of Phase 2 were offered a 4 week treatment extension with amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg plus hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ) 12.5 mg taken orally in the morning.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Patients Who Achieved Normalized Blood Pressure During the Core Phase of the Study
outcomeMeasures.description: Normalized Blood Pressure was defined as a msSBP \< 140 mmHg and/or a msDBP \< 90 mmHg.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Intent-to-treat population (ITT): All patients who took at least one dose of amlodipine plus valsartan who had at least one primary efficacy parameter evaluation. Patients who dropped out were included in the ITT population if there was any BP measurement available; their last available blood pressure measurement was used for the analysis.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline Phase 2 (Week 4) to end of Phase 2 (Week 8)

groups.title: Amlodipine+Valsartan - Phase 2
groups.description: Patients with uncontrolled mean sitting diastolic BP (msDBP ≥ 90 mmHg) at the end of Phase 1 were treated for 4 weeks with amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg taken orally in the morning.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Patients Who Achieved a Protocol-defined Blood Pressure Response During the Core Phase of the Study
outcomeMeasures.description: Blood pressure response was defined as msSBP \< 140 mmHg or a 20 mmHg decrease in msSBP at the end of Phase 2 (Week 8) compared to Baseline in Phase 2 (week 4) or a msDBP \< 90 mmHg or a 10 mmHg decrease in msDBP at the end of Phase 2 compared to Baseline in Phase 2.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Intent-to-treat population (ITT): All patients who took at least one dose of amlodipine plus valsartan who had at least one primary efficacy parameter evaluation. Patients who dropped out were included in the ITT population if there was any BP measurement available; their last available blood pressure measurement was used for the analysis.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline of Phase 2 (Week 4) to end of Phase 2 (Week 8)

eventGroups.title: Phase 1 - Amlodipine+Olmesartan
eventGroups.description: 4 weeks treatment with amlodipine 10 mg plus olmesartan 20 mg taken orally once daily in the morning.

eventGroups.title: Phase 2 - Amlodipine+Valsartan
eventGroups.description: Patients with uncontrolled mean sitting diastolic BP (msDBP ≥ 90 mmHg) at the end of Phase 1 were treated for 4 weeks with amlodipine 10 mg plus valsartan 160 mg taken orally in the morning.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
